poem:
Title: "In Memory of Jim Davis"

In the audacious theatre of life,
Jim Directed – aged 74.
A scholar of greasepaint's strife,
His words, a standing ovation's allure.
At Warwick's stage he did conduct,
A performance of academic rigor,
His work, to history it would construct,
Writing the lines of theatre's vigor.
His final act now takes its bow,
The curtain falls, but not the acclaim.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Jim Davis obituary My friend Jim Davis, who has died aged 74, was an internationally respected theatre historian, inspirational lecturer and a leading authority on 19th-century theatre. From 2004 to 2009 he was head of theatre and performance studies at the University of Warwick, where he established the department’s reputation for excellence. Jim published widely and to critical acclaim. His most recent book, Comic Acting and Portraiture in Late-Georgian and Regency England (2015), won the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
